title: How about matching fonts to horror movie titles...
content:
I'll start you off...

The Mummy's Revenge - Papyrus  
Childs Play - Comic Sans  
The Thing - Gill Sans Ultra Bold  
The Shinn-ing - Handsome  
Rosemary's Baby - Sassoon Primary  
The Hound of the Baskervilles - er do i really need to say  
The Blob - Helvetica Rounded Extra Bold  
The Birds - Swift  
Signs - Intersate

need inspiration? [http://www.imdb.com/chart/horror](http://web.archive.org/web/20101218064945/http:/www.imdb.com/chart/horror "http://www.imdb.com/chart/horror") & [http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20101218064945/http:/www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=fonts "http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=fonts")
author: Sii Daniels

comments.content: oh goody, let me think, give me a minute, give me a minute
Ok, so [children of the Corn](http://web.archive.org/web/20101218064945/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0087050/posters) = ITC Benguiat

No, I think that one should be " [Dog day afternoon](http://web.archive.org/web/20101218064945/http:/www.imdb.com/title/tt0072890/)"

The Invisible Man - one of Chris' unreleased fonts :-(

_Maybe “Childsplay” would be Gill_

now THAT'S scary!

"The Invisible Man - one of Chris’ unreleased fonts :-("

NOW that is really scary to me, the gutless wonder :-)

ChrisL

Ok so let's just say I didn't get the game :/  
slow...

they're all gonna laugh at you
Invasion of the Bodysnatchers. Helvetica neue
